org.mortbay.http
Class HttpMessage.Implementation

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.mortbay.http.HttpMessage.Implementation
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpMessage
Direct Known Subclasses:
HttpRequest, HttpResponse
Enclosing class:
HttpMessage
public abstract static class HttpMessage.Implementation
extends java.lang.Object
implements HttpMessage

Default HttpMessage Implementation. The default Implementation of HttpMessage provides the common handling for HttpRequest and HttpResponse.

Inner classes inherited from class org.mortbay.http.HttpMessage
HttpMessage.Implementation, HttpMessage.Request, HttpMessage.Response

Method Detail

setFacade

public void setFacade(HttpMessage facade)
Set a facade object. A Facade object is a wrapper object that is associated with this message and presents it with an different interface. The primary example of a HttpRequest facade is ServletHttpRequest. A single facade object may be associated with the message with this call and retrieved with the getFacade method.
Parameters:
facade - Message facade

getFacade

public HttpMessage getFacade()
Get an associated facade object.
Returns:
Facade message or null.

getHttpMessage

public HttpMessage getHttpMessage()
Get an associated facade object or this HttpMessage itself.
Returns:
Facade message or this.
See Also:
setFacade()

getOutputStream in interface HttpMessage

getState

public int getState()
Get the message state. 
 __MSG_EDITABLE = 0 - Created locally, all set methods enabled
 __MSG_BAD      = 1 - Bad message or send failure.
 __MSG_RECEIVED = 2 - Received from connection.
 __MSG_SENDING  = 3 - Headers sent.
 __MSG_SENT     = 4 - Entity and trailers sent.
Returns:
the state.

setState

public int setState(int state)
Set the message state. This method should be used by experts only as it can prevent normal handling of a request/response.
Parameters:
state - The new state
Returns:
the last state.

getVersion

public java.lang.String getVersion()
Get the protocol version.
Returns:
return the version.

getDotVersion

public int getDotVersion()
Get the protocol version.
Returns:
return the version dot (0.9=-1 1.0=0 1.1=1)

setField

public java.lang.String setField(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String value)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Set a field value. If the message is editable, then a header field is set. Otherwise if the message is sending and a HTTP/1.1 version, then a trailer field is set.
Specified by:
setField in interface HttpMessage
Parameters:
name - Name of field
value - New value of field
Returns:
Old value of field
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - Not editable or sending 1.1 with trailers

getIntField

public int getIntField(java.lang.String name)
Get a field as an integer value. Look in header and trailer fields. Returns the value of an integer field, or -1 if not found. The case of the field name is ignored.
Specified by:
getIntField in interface HttpMessage
Parameters:
name - the case-insensitive field name

public void commit()
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.lang.IllegalStateException
